org.sosy_lab.solver.api

Interface UnsafeFormulaManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractUnsafeFormulaManager, CVC4UnsafeFormulaManager

    public interface UnsafeFormulaManager
    This interface contains methods for formula traversal, which generally should be avoided.

        arity of the input formula.

boolean isAtom(Formula f)

        Returns:
        whether the given Formula is an atom.

        boolean isVariable(Formula f)
        Returns:
        whether the given Formula is a variable, either free or quantified

        boolean isFreeVariable(Formula f)
        Returns:
        whether the given Formula is a free (not quantified) variable.

        Returns:
        whether the given Formula is a bound (by a quantifier) variable.

        Returns:

boolean isQuantification(Formula f)
        Deprecated. Use visit(FormulaVisitor, Formula) instead.
        Returns:

      • getQuantifiedBody

        BooleanFormula getQuantifiedBody(Formula pQuantifiedFormula)
        Get the body of the given, quantified, formula.

        Precondition: isQuantification(Formula) returns true for this formula.

      • replaceQuantifiedBody

        BooleanFormula replaceQuantifiedBody(BooleanFormula pF,
                                     BooleanFormula pNewBody)
        Replace the body of a quantified formula.

        Precondition: isQuantification(Formula) returns true for the first parameter.

      • getName

        String getName(Formula f)
        Returns the name of the formula (or function)

      • replaceArgsAndName

        <T extends Formula> T replaceArgsAndName(T f,
                                         String newName,
                                         List<Formula> args)
        Replaces the name and the arguments of the given formula. The old and the new name need to be of the same type. If f is a variable, use an empty list of arguments.

      • replaceArgs

        <T extends Formula> T replaceArgs(T f,
                                  List<Formula> args)
        Replaces the arguments of the given formula

      • splitNumeralEqualityIfPossible

        <T extends Formula> List<T> splitNumeralEqualityIfPossible(T f)
        If the given formula is a numeral (i.e., non-boolean) equality "x = y", return a list x<=y, x>=y.

        Otherwise, return the unchanged formula. Note: 1) Returned list always has one or two elements. 2) Conjunction over the returned list is equivalent to the input formula.

      • substitute

        Formula substitute(Formula f,
                   Map<Formula,Formula> fromToMapping)
        Substitute every occurrence of any item from changeFrom in formula f to the corresponding occurrence from changeTo.

        E.g. if changeFrom contains a variable a and changeTo contains a variable b all occurrences of a will be changed to b in the returned formula.

        Parameters:
        f - Formula to change.
        fromToMapping - Mapping of old and new formula parts.
        Returns:
        Formula with parts replaced.

      • visit

        <R> R visit(FormulaVisitor<R> visitor,
            Formula f)
